definition: first of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/(used for an unspecified person or thing)/first (in a list, as a party to a contract etc)/letter "A" or roman "I" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/armor plating/shell or carapace/(of the fingers or toes) nail/bladed leather or metal armor (old)/ranking system used in the Imperial examinations (old)/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)/ancient Chinese compass point: 75°

sentences.english: Even the nails on the suits and the hair and beards of the soldiers are carefully detailed.
sentences.chinese: 那铠甲上最小甲钉甚至武士俑的头发胡子都丝丝可见。

sentences.english: The Soviet knight is dying inside his armor.
sentences.chinese: 苏联骑士正在他的铠甲内死去。

sentences.english: “Let’s throw a little alligator in there for armor, ” Conrad says.
sentences.chinese: 我们就让小型短吻鳄的皮肤来作为龙的铠甲吧。

sentences.english: Only two sets of battle armors perhaps still don't go?
sentences.chinese: 只有两套铠甲恐怕还不行吧？

sentences.english: He had a bronze helmet on his head and wore a coat of scale armor of bronze weighing five thousand shekels;
sentences.chinese: 头戴铜盔，身穿铠甲，甲重五千舍客勒。

sentences.english: Griff paced the deck, mail clinking softly beneath his wolfskin cloak.
sentences.chinese: 格里夫在甲板上踱步，铠甲在他狼皮斗篷下轻轻碰撞。

sentences.english: I never saw armors created for cats and mice.
sentences.chinese: 我从没见过为猫和老鼠打造的铠甲。

sentences.english: They're allowed no armor, only a loincloth.
sentences.chinese: 决斗者不能穿任何铠甲，只能希一条裹腰布。

sentences.english: Masterwork weapons and armour should be rare and expensive.
sentences.chinese: 杰作武器和铠甲应当稀少而且昂贵。

sentences.english: Page 79: The evil spirit fled the father's body and transferred into a nearby suit of armor.
sentences.chinese: 恶魔离开父亲体内后，转移到附近房者的一套铠甲里。

sentences.english: Some of the new English troops are in, plus a dozen or so new armors .
sentences.chinese: 一些新的英文部队在，再加上十几个新的铠甲。

sentences.english: What makes someone collect arms and armour?
sentences.chinese: 是什么使得有人收集武器和铠甲？

sentences.english: Armor was used by the soldiers to protect themselves in the cold weapon era.
sentences.chinese: 铠甲是冷兵器战争时代将士披挂在身上的防护装具。

sentences.english: Page 48: The clatter of armor and clanking of metal could be heard.
sentences.chinese: 铠甲的哗啦声和干戈相碰的金属声已经能听到。

sentences.english: But the overpressure wave inevitably passes through the rigid armor layer.
sentences.chinese: 但是，超压冲击波必然会穿透坚固的铠甲层。

sentences.english: Mage Assassins have a new set of armor unique to this class combo.
sentences.chinese: 法刺有了一套新的专用铠甲了。

definition: to put on a suit of armor/to put on dress/to wear
